TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit OdbcPermission extends System.Data.Common.DBDataPermission

Docs.summary: Enables the .NET Framework Data Provider for ODBC to help make sure that a user has a security level sufficient to access an ODBC data source. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This class is intended for future use when the .NET Framework Data Provider for ODBC is enabled for partial trust scenarios. The .NET Framework Data Provider for ODBD currently requires FullTrust permission. Currently, using the `OdbcPermission` class has no effect. For more information, see [Code Access Security and ADO.NET](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("OdbcPermission() has been deprecated. Use the OdbcPermission(PermissionState.None) constructor. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=14202", true)

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The base constructor initializes all fields to their default values.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState state) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with one of the values.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState state, bool allowBlankPassword) cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("OdbcPermission(PermissionState state, Boolean allowBlankPassword) has been deprecated. Use the OdbcPermission(PermissionState.None) constructor. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=14202", true)

Docs.param: Indicates whether a blank password is allowed.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> enumeration takes precedence over the <xref:System.Data.Common.DBDataPermission.AllowBlankPassword%2A> property. Therefore, if you set <xref:System.Data.Common.DBDataPermission.AllowBlankPassword%2A> to `false`, you must also set <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> to `None` to prevent a user from making a connection using a blank password.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void Add (string connectionString, string restrictions, System.Data.KeyRestrictionBehavior behavior);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void Add(string connectionString, string restrictions, valuetype System.Data.KeyRestrictionBehavior behavior) cil managed

Docs.param: String that identifies connection string parameters that are allowed or disallowed.
Docs.summary: Adds access for the specified connection string to the existing state of the permission.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method can be useful when you implement the following:
- a .NET Framework data provider.
- an API that must assert for data access permission.
- an administrative tool or installation program that must modify security policy.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission Copy() cil managed

Docs.returns: A copy of the current permission object.
